body_html:
You can install cuda-9-0 via aptitude command, it will fix something automatically.
In a word, I install Tensorflow by following:

step 1: nvidia driver
step 2: install cuda

sudo dpkg -i cuda-local.....deb
sudo apt-key add <..>  # it will be printed after step 1. 
                       # If u don't see this be printed, it might be some wrong while step 1.
sudo aptitude install cuda
# In this step, it might show somethings, just enter yes.

step 3: install cudnn

just copy files into the /..../cuda-9-0/

step 4: set environment
this step is so important, I tried just type export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=.. in command line, but it would be remove after reboot.
so add the following lines into the file ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc

export PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}

or edit /etc/environment

PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin:.... # place before the old. Don't forget ":"
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64

then reboot.
By doing those, I think it could work.

body:
You can install cuda-9-0 via aptitude command, it will fix something automatically.
In a word,  I install Tensorflow by following: 

**step 1: nvidia driver**
**step 2: install cuda**
```bash
sudo dpkg -i cuda-local.....deb
sudo apt-key add <..>  # it will be printed after step 1. 
                       # If u don't see this be printed, it might be some wrong while step 1.
sudo aptitude install cuda
# In this step, it might show somethings, just enter yes.
```
**step 3: install cudnn**

just copy files into the /..../cuda-9-0/ 

**step 4: set environment**
this step is so important, I tried just type  `export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=..` in command line, but it would be remove after reboot.
so add the following lines into the file ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc
```bash
export PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}

```

or edit /etc/environment
```bash
PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin:.... # place before the old. Don't forget ":"
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64
```
then reboot.
By doing those, I think it could work.
